| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | [EvilHack - monst.c, line 1098](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/master/src/monst.c#L1098) |

A **giant centipede**, s, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a [large](/wiki/Large "Large"), [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") and [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous") type of [centipede](/wiki/Arachnid_or_centipede "Arachnid or centipede") that is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), accurate, and has the ability to conceal itself under [items](/wiki/Item "Item") like its smaller [centipede](/wiki/Centipede "Centipede") cousins.

A giant centipede has a powerful [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") bite attack and a touch attack that allows them to wrap their body around the victim, and possesses [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

Eating a giant centipede [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") confers +6% (3⁄50) [additional poison resistance](/wiki/Partial_intrinsic "Partial intrinsic").

## Generation

Randomly generated giant centipedes are always created hostile.

Giant centipedes appear among the random s that are part of the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for [Tourists](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Tourist quest](/wiki/Tourist_quest "Tourist quest"). They also appear among the random s that are part of the second quest monster class for [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Ranger quest](/wiki/Ranger_quest "Ranger quest").

Hostile giant centipedes can be generated by the [summon insects](/wiki/Summon_insects "Summon insects") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") when cast by [Lolth](/wiki/Lolth_\(EvilHack\) "Lolth (EvilHack)") or a [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(monster_attribute\) "Drow (monster attribute)") monster.

Giant centipedes generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under.

## Strategy

Giant centipedes are especially nasty monsters, with twice the base speed of an unhasted character, a strong [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") of -6, a powerful poisonous bite, and the ability to restrict a character's escape using their touch attack.

## Encyclopedia entry

I observed here, what I had often seen before, that certain  
districts abound in centipedes. Here they have light  
reddish bodies and blue legs; great myriapedes are seen  
crawling every where. Although they do no harm, they excite  
in man a feeling of loathing. Perhaps our appearance  
produces a similar feeling in the elephant and other large  
animals. Where they have been much disturbed, they  
certainly look upon us with great distrust, as the horrid  
biped that ruins their peace.  
\[ Travels and Researches in South Africa,  
by Dr. David Livingstone ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Giant_centipede\&action=edit)*

html:
Giant centipede

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
s giant centipede (No tile)
Difficulty 20
Attacks Bite 6d8 poison, Touch 1d4 special
s giant centipede (No tile)
Difficulty 20
Attacks

Bite 6d8 poison, Touch 1d4 special

Base level 16
Base experience 517
Speed 24
Base AC -6
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 600
Nutritional value 300
Size Large
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed poison (+6%)

A giant centipede:

  • can hide under items.
  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 1098

A giant centipede, s, is a type of monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. It is a large, carnivorous and oviparous type of centipede that is strong, accurate, and has the ability to conceal itself under items like its smaller centipede cousins.

A giant centipede has a powerful poisonous bite attack and a touch attack that allows them to wrap their body around the victim, and possesses poison resistance.

Eating a giant centipede corpse or tin confers +6% (3⁄50) additional poison resistance.

Generation

Randomly generated giant centipedes are always created hostile.

Giant centipedes appear among the random s that are part of the first quest monster class for Tourists and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Tourist quest. They also appear among the random s that are part of the second quest monster class for Rangers and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Ranger quest.

Hostile giant centipedes can be generated by the summon insects monster spell when cast by Lolth or a drow monster.

Giant centipedes generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under.

Strategy

Giant centipedes are especially nasty monsters, with twice the base speed of an unhasted character, a strong AC of -6, a powerful poisonous bite, and the ability to restrict a character's escape using their touch attack.

Encyclopedia entry

I observed here, what I had often seen before, that certain
districts abound in centipedes. Here they have light
reddish bodies and blue legs; great myriapedes are seen
crawling every where. Although they do no harm, they excite
in man a feeling of loathing. Perhaps our appearance
produces a similar feeling in the elephant and other large
animals. Where they have been much disturbed, they
certainly look upon us with great distrust, as the horrid
biped that ruins their peace.
[ Travels and Researches in South Africa,
by Dr. David Livingstone ]

A '''giant centipede''', {{orange|s}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a [[large]], [[carnivorous]] and [[oviparous]] type of [[arachnid or centipede|centipede]] that is [[strong]], accurate, and has the ability to conceal itself under [[item]]s like its smaller [[centipede]] cousins.

A giant centipede has a powerful [[poisonous]] bite attack and a touch attack that allows them to wrap their body around the victim, and possesses [[poison resistance]].

Eating a giant centipede [[corpse]] or [[tin]] confers +6% ({{frac|3|50}}) [[Partial intrinsic|additional poison resistance]].

==Generation==
Randomly generated giant centipedes are always created hostile.

Giant centipedes appear among the random {{white|s}} that are part of the first [[quest]] monster class for [[Tourist]]s and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Tourist quest]]. They also appear among the random {{white|s}} that are part of the second quest monster class for [[Ranger]]s and make up {{frac|6|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Ranger quest]].

Hostile giant centipedes can be generated by the [[summon insects]] [[monster spell]] when cast by [[Lolth (EvilHack)|Lolth]] or a [[Drow (monster attribute)|drow]] monster.

Giant centipedes generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under.

==Strategy==
Giant centipedes are especially nasty monsters, with twice the base speed of an unhasted character, a strong [[AC]] of -6, a powerful poisonous bite, and the ability to restrict a character's escape using their touch attack.
